title: Kiper's latest NFL mock draft: Projecting the entire first round ahead of the combine
content: As the NFL gets ready for this week's combine workouts, let's project where the best players in the 2026 draft class will get picked in April.

title: Sources: Sale, Braves agree to $27M extension
content: Chris Sale and the Braves are in agreement on a one-year, $27 million contract extension for 2027 that includes a club option for 2028, sources told ESPN.

title: Eagles' Sirianni 'can't guarantee' Brown's return
content: Philadelphia Eagles coach Nick Sirianni says there is mutual interest between the team and wide receiver A.J. Brown, but doesn't commit to him playing this year.

title: Lions will head to Munich for international game
content: For the first time since 2015, the Lions will play an international game, this time in Munich, Germany, with their opponent and date to be named later.

title: QB Rivers follows in dad Philip's path to NC State
content: Four-star quarterback Gunner Rivers, son of NC State legend and eight-time NFL Pro Bowler Philip Rivers, has committed to the Wolfpack.

title: UFL making changes on field goal points, punts
content: For its 2026 season, which starts March 27, the UFL will award four points for field goals of at least 60 yards, and ban most punts inside of the opponent's 50.

title: Grand jury doesn't indict Beverley in assault case
content: A grand jury returned a no-bill in the case involving former NBA guard Patrick Beverley, who was arrested last fall in what police called a "family violence" incident.

title: Sources: Mexico game still on amid cartel violence
content: Mexico plans to proceed with its friendly match scheduled against Iceland on Wednesday at the Corregidora Stadium in Queretaro amid unrest and violence in the country, sources told ESPN.

title: U.S. women's hockey team declines Trump invite
content: The U.S. women's hockey Olympic gold medal-winning team has politely declined an invitation from President Donald Trump to attend his State of the Union address.

title: Ranking the top 10 shortstops in MLB: Is Witt, Henderson or Perdomo No. 1?
content: Buster Olney's ranking of the top players at every position continues with the premier infield position: shortstop. Find out who comes out on top of this star-studded field.

title: Men's Bracketology: Duke's ascension to No. 1 overall was inevitable
content: It was only a matter of time until a path opened for the Blue Devils, who ride their win over Michigan to the top.

title: Women's Bracketology: How two upsets turned the ACC into a nine-bid league
content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

title: 2026 NBA draft: Biggest questions for 10 lottery-bound teams
content: NBA insiders break down biggest questions for 10 lottery-bounds teams after the trade deadline and ahead of the draft.

title: NFL free agency tiers: Barnwell ranks the best QBs, RBs, WRs, TEs and OL
content: NFL free agency is almost here, and we placed players on offense into tiers based on their potential offseason contracts. Who could get paid?

title: Key factors that could define the men's NCAA tournament selection process
content: From metrics to star injuries and Charles Bediako, the key discussion points that could define March Madness.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Welcome to the 'locks,' Wisconsin
content: Wisconsin cemented its status as a 'lock' Sunday, though the SEC continues to lead the Big Ten in projected bids.

title: They're back! Key returning players for every top 25 team
content: With all the focus on the portal, we look at the most important players retained across college football.

title: Premier League summer transfers: A bunch of busts, or just proof patience is needed?
content: The slew of high-priced players who joined the Premier League in the summer transfer window haven't exactly been on fire. Why the slow starts?

title: 'The time is now': Inside the Darryn Peterson availability saga at Kansas
content: The projected No. 1 NBA draft pick has sat out enough time to cast uncertainty on his team's potential in March.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: OU, Iowa and TCU on the rise
content: The new AP Top 25 is here! Which teams moved up? Which team replaced Tennessee, which fell out of the poll?

title: As NIL cash grows, coaches call for rules to protect athletes from 'street agents'
content: Coaches and other observers see a growing need to protect athletes by regulating middlemen in NIL deals.

title: We predicted the 12-man USA basketball roster in the 2028 Olympics
content: In a time of transition for USA basketball, here's what the 12-man squad that will go up against a competitive international slate could look like.

title: Why pitch tipping is going to be the most talked-about term in 2026
content: With a new rule already in place, MLB front offices are cracking down on another tiny way to get an advantage.

title: Back at the Bernabéu: Could Mourinho return to coach Real Madrid again?
content: Wednesday's clash isn't just a chance for José Mourinho's Benfica to eliminate Real Madrid from the Champions League. It might also be an audition.

title: MLS Power Rankings: LAFC lead the way after win over champs Miami and Lionel Messi
content: LAFC get a convincing win over defending champions Inter Miami to kick off the 2026 MLS season and the latest ESPN Power Rankings.

title: Who makes Team USA in men's hockey at the 2030 Olympics?
content: While the 2026 roster returns home with medals, here's who could represent the U.S. in the French Alps Games.

title: Dreams on paper, gold on ice: Revisiting Jack Hughes' and Alysa Liu's 2019 letters
content: In 2019, Hughes and Liu wrote to their retired selves. In 2026, they added Olympic gold to the story.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Man United, Real Madrid eye Van de Ven
content: Tottenham Hotspur defender Micky van de Ven is on the radar of Liverpool, Manchester United and Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: Pick up Melton, Wallace and Raynaud for the homestretch
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Fantasy hockey pickups: Why Dostal, Laferriere are post-Olympics must-adds
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: TTD initiates a 15-day scrap clearance drive
content: TTD Additional EO asks officials to prepare a structured disposal schedule, mandating scrap clearance once every six months

title: BJP Yuva Morcha gives memorandum to Governor on Gulbarga University irregularities
content: Delegation seeks his intervention to address the university’s administrative and financial irregularities

title: Uthralikkavu Pooram dazzles with elephants, melam and vibrant rituals
content: Massive crowds gather in post-harvest paddy fields as Enkakkad, Kumaranellur and Wadakkanchery desams bring alive centuries-old traditions

title: Northeast CMs condemn ‘racial abuse’ of Arunachal Pradesh women in Delhi
content: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu says such behaviour is unacceptable and has no place in society

title: Protest planned in Hubballi, Bagalkot tomorrow
content: Various organisations have decided to take part in it condemning the stone-throwing incident during a Shivaji procession in Bagalkot

title: Free housing pattas distributed to 3.09 lakh beneficiaries of Adi Dravidar and tribal communities
content: About 1,000 housing units with 90% subsidy have been given to conservancy workers. The free meals programme has benefitted 1.29 lakh conservancy workers in urban local bodies, says the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department

title: Mandya gears up to tackle summer thirst; ZP CEO warns officials
content: No village to face water shortage this summer, says Ms K R Nandini; Village-wise plan ready to ensure uninterrupted water supply in the district

title: Job fairs being held in every district to help unemployed: Santosh Lad
content: The Minister says that the State government has been working to create employment opportunities for aspiring youth

title: Bengaluru North Corporation notifies 70 stray dog feeding spots
content: ‘Steps have been taken to ensure humane management of street dogs while balancing public health and environmental cleanliness’

title: ‘Nirbhaya Nisha’ to boost women’s safety: Pinarayi
content: Chief Minister says project designed by Kerala Police is a model step to ensure women’s safety. It will serve to instil a sense of safety among women who travel at odd hours for work and other essential needs

title: UN launches road safety financing project in four States
content: UN Road Safety Fund-backed initiative in Rajasthan, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Assam targets 50% reduction in road traffic deaths by 2030

title: India set to launch free nationwide HPV vaccination for adolescent girls
content: India will use Gardasil, a quadrivalent HPV vaccine, for protection from HPV types 16 and 18, which cause cervical cancer, as well as types 6 and 11

title: 19,133 graduates receive degrees at Gulbarga University convocation
content: Governor and Chancellor Thaawar Chand Gehlot presents honorary degrees to three distinguished personalities

title: 'Affordable world-class healthcare for all' should be mission: President
content: “I am confident that India will gain prestige as a global healthcare destination,” says President Murmu

title: Kharge family has meted out injustice to Dalit leaders, says Chalavadi Narayanaswamy
content: The Leader of Opposition in the Council says the Kharge family has deprived many Dalit leaders, including himself, of opportunities

title: MP vows coordinated action plan for development of Vijayawada
content: Vijayawada Municipal Corporation, public representatives and other departments concerned will sit and discuss an action plan for development of the city, says Kesineni Sivanath

title: Crash in tobacco prices: Yaduveer seeks Union Commerce Minister’s immediate intervention
content: The Mysuru MP highlights that tobacco prices have dropped by ₹50 to ₹70 per kg, resulting in heavy losses for farmers.

title: H.C. Mahadevappa may know about change of Chief Minister ‘because he is high command’, says D.K. Shivakumar
content: To a query on his silence on statements issued by various leaders, Shivakumar said it is the Chief Minister who has to regulate Ministers and MLAs

title: In Focus | India’s Rare Earth strategy: Digging beneath the Budget announcements
content: In this episode, guest Shobhankita Reddy discusses India’s ambitious plans for rare earth elements, highlighting how new initiatives in states like Odisha and Tamil Nadu aim to boost local production and independence.

title: Ugadi Jatra Mahotsava in Hubballi from tomorrow
content: Sadguru Siddeshwar Swami Hosamath at Unkal will organise the festivities with a series of religious, cultural and community programmes

title: Standing Committee passes resolution on commending India AI Summit
content: Opposition backs praise for India AI Impact Summit but objects to BJP move to flag protest incident, calling the committee a forum for coordination, not confrontation

title: Most adventure tourism firms in Idukki functioning without a local body licence
content: Collector forms seven-member expert team to inspect all adventure activity firms in the district and submit a detailed report

title: Madras High Court dismisses Vaiko’s case against ban imposed on LTTE under UAPA
content: Justices Anita Sumanth and Mummineni Sudheer Kumar reject the case after the Centre questions his locus standi and says the ban was imposed in the interest of national security

title: Sreedharan unveils ₹56,500 crore high-speed rail plan
content: The Kerala High Speed Rail aims at reducing travel time between Thiruvananthapuram and Kannur to just three hours and 20 minutes. It will cover 465 km with 20 stations, linking key airports and promising to alleviate road congestion while cutting carbon emissions.

title: Thousands of commuters suffer as Southern Railway further reduces suburban train services in Chennai
content: Train services were initially reduced from the normal 204 to 160 in both up and down directions. They have now been further cut to 115

title: Watch: Kerala to Keralam: What the Constitution says about a State name change
content: The move, announced by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, now sets in motion a constitutional process under Article 3 involving the President and Parliament. With Assembly elections approaching, here is what the change means and what happens next.

title: Manipur CM, deputies meet PM Modi
content: The Chief Minister briefed PM Modi, on the steps taken by the new State Government to bring peace and harmony in the State, a Manipur Government release said, adding that he also urged the Prime Minister to take special care of women's empowerment in both the hills and the valley

title: NDA to finalise Assam seat-sharing by mid-March: CM
content: Talks with AGP and UPPL at advanced stage; Rajya Sabha polls add to alliance churn as BPF and AIUDF recalibrate positions

title: 1,600 posts in State fire dept. will be filled soon, says Home Minister
content: With a spike in high-rise buildings in Bengaluru, the department has been equipped with modern and advanced machinery. For the first time, a 90-m aerial ladder platform vehicle capable of reaching significant heights has been inducted into the fleet, says R. Parameshwara

title: Astrologer sentenced to 200-year rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting two minor girls in Sivaganga
content: Judge Gokulmurugan, who heard the case, sentenced Ramakrishnan to 100 years of rigorous imprisonment for each victim, totaling 200 years, and imposed a fine of ₹2 lakh

title: Union Minister claims unauthorised presence of former Bengal Chief Secretary at Supreme Court-mandated SIR meeting
content: The BJP leader demanded a probe into the issue and the arrest of Mr. Pant. Mr. Majumdar accused the State’s TMC Government of trying to influence the judiciary during the meeting held on February 21

title: Arippa protesters stage mass hunger strike over alleged corruption
content: Protesters allege that revenue officials are actively sabotaging the title deed (pattaya) distribution process to favour the timber mafia.

title: ‘Kerala’ to ‘Keralam’: What is the process to change the name of a State?
content: India has a long history of changing the names of States. From ‘Orissa’ to ‘Odisha’ and ‘Uttaranchal’ to ‘Uttarakhand’, know all about the constitutional process of changing the name of a place.

title: Hyderabad police arrest 104 in pan-India cyber fraud crackdown under Operation Octopus; accused linked to 1,055 cases
content: The officers uncovered a structured network involving mule account holders, middlemen and even a banking insider

title: Jharkhand air ambulance crash: Bodies of 7 deceased handed over to family members after post-mortem
content: The post-mortem was conducted at Sadar Hospital in Chatra."The bodies have been handed over to family members after the autopsy,” say a health department official

title: Union Cabinet holds first meeting at Seva Teerth
content: Resolution at new Prime Minister’s Office complex reiterates commitment to “Developed India 2047” and reform-driven governance

title: PM Modi should scrap ‘anti-farmer’ trade deal with U.S., says Rahul Gandhi
content: “The Indo-U.S. trade deal is against the interests of our farmers and was done by PM Modi under the pressure of U.S. President Donald Trump because of Epstein files and to save industrialist Adani,” Rahul Gandhi said

title: What happens to terms Keralite, Keralan: Tharoor on ‘Keralam’ replacing Kerala
content: The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi approved the proposal for altering the name of Kerala to Keralam

title: Cricket fan travels from U.K. to Hubballi for Ranji Trophy final
content: For the last two decades, 65-year-old Yorkshire County Cricket club fan Ian has been following Ranji Trophy matches

title: A.P. seeks CRZ reclassification for Vizag Beach Road to boost tourism projects
content: Visakhapatnam was the crown jewel of Andhra Pradesh’s tourism sector and that the coalition government was committed to developing it into an international tourism destination, the Minister told the Assembly

title: Shashi Tharoor extolls installation of Rajaji’s statue at Rashtrapati Bhavan
content: Shashi Tharoor said he always admired Rajaji’s convictions and he was a strong supporter of his Swatantra Party

title: Every violation of RBI fraud rules not open to court scrutiny: Bombay High Court on lifting Anil Ambani case stay
content: The Bombay High Court quashed a single Bench order, which stayed the action initiated by three public sector banks based on the Master Directions issued by the RBI to classify Anil Ambani as fraud

title: Cabinet approves three railway projects worth ₹9,072 cr covering eight districts in four States
content: The three projects include the doubling of the Gondia-Jabalpur section and the laying of the third and fourth lines between Punarakh-Kiul and Gamharia-Chandil sections

title: Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati moves Allahabad HC seeking anticipatory bail in POCSO case
content: It has been alleged that the accused, posing as religious preceptors, subjected the minor and another youth to repeated sexual assault on multiple occasions over the past year

title: SC declines plea to remove Aadhaar from SIR document list, says RP Act still endorses it as identity proof
content: Court says petitioner-advocate Ashwini Kumar Upadhyay should take his apprehensions that fake Aadhaar cards are manufactured on an “industrial scale” in the border areas to the Union Government

title: Top maoists underground for three to four decades surrender before Telangana police; only one central committee member active
content: With reintegration of a politburo member and a central committee member into mainstream, the last surviving apex organisational structure of CPI (Maoist) has effectively collapsed, said Telangana DGP Shivadhar Reddy

title: Cabinet clears ₹1,677 crore Srinagar airport expansion
content: Srinagar airport expansion to raise passenger capacity to 10 MPPA; new terminal and aircraft bays approved

title: Adivasi man killed in suspected carnivore attack in Nilgiris
content: Residents staged a protest by blocking the road between Udhagamandalam and Gudalur at the Sholur Junction, demanding the animal’s capture

title: PM Modi’s Israel visit faces geopolitical headwinds
content: Netanyahu’s “hexagonal alliance plans, U.S. threats to attack Iran, condemnation of Israel West Bank plans complicate optics of Modi-Netanyahu meet

title: New Collectors for Chengalpattu, Kancheepuram, and Karur districts
content: S. Malathi Helen was named Chengalpattu Collector, while D. Sneha and G. Ravikumar were appointed Collectors of Kancheepuram and Karur districts, respectively

title: AISATS to invest ₹4,458 cr in Jewar airport projects; MoU signed during Yogi Adityanath’s Singapore visit
content: The agreement was signed during Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath’s ongoing visit to Singapore, marking a key investment outcome on the second day of the tour aimed at attracting global capital to Uttar Pradesh

title: EV infrastructure in housing societies: Supreme Court issues notice; agrees to examine plea
content: The petition said the installation of electric vehicle chargers would enable residents to have “safe and sufficient infrastructure for charging their e-vehicles in the society at their own cost”

title: Kerala to become ‘Keralam’: Union Cabinet approves change of name
content: The Kerala Assembly on June 24, 2024, had unanimously adopted a resolution urging the Centre to officially change the State’s name to Keralam

title: Chhattisgarh Budget: ₹1.72 lakh crore allotted for 2026-27; government announces financial scheme for girls
content: The government will launch the Rani Durgavati Scheme under which girls will receive Rs 1.5 lakh on attaining 18 years of age, Chhattisgarh Finance Minister said

title: T.N. Assembly election: AIADMK’s third round of poll promises offers ₹1,000 to ration cardholders during Pongal
content: The party also said it would give ₹10,000 as solatium to every family that was hit by the “impact of inflation” and “tax hikes” effected during the current DMK regime. The AIADMK has made 16 poll promises so far.

title: Kerala Assembly passes Nativity Card Bill
content: Amid continuing non-cooperation by Congress-led UDF Opposition, Kerala Assembly passes nine Bills, including Nativity Card Bill

title: In pictures: Experiencing Theyyam in Kerala
content: As the Theyyam season reaches its peak, this Kerala’s ritual art is based on centuries-old folklore.

title: Jharkhand air ambulance crash: Probe underway into cause
content: Investigation launched into Jharkhand air ambulance crash that killed seven, focusing on weather conditions and communication loss

title: Mahatma Gandhi’s great grandson opposes displacement for Gandhi Sarovar project of Musi Development
content: Appealing Telangana Chief Minister not to displace people, he posted stating Bapu would have said “Not in my Name, Stop it!”

title: Kantara remark: Karnataka High Court directs police not to take coercive action against actor Ranveer Singh
content: FIR registered against actor for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by his act of ‘mocking’ the sacred daiva tradition portrayed in the Kannada film Kantara Chapter 1

title: Students must leave Iran before panic strikes: Farooq Abdullah
content: In its latest advisory, the Embassy of India asked its citizens to "leave Iran by available means of transport, including commercial flights."

title: Rinku Singh rushes back home due to medical emergency in family
content: India batter Rinku Singh has flown back home due to a medical emergency in the family. It is reliably learnt that his father was undergoing treatment for close to an year due to cancer and his condition has detoriated in the last 24 hours.

title: After Keralam, Bangla? Mamata renews demand for name change; attacks BJP
content: The Union Cabinet approved Kerala's name change to Keralam. This sparked a political row. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee questioned why her state's proposal to be renamed Bangla is pending. She accused the Centre of discrimination. The Centre's decision comes ahead of assembly elections in both states.

title: What is Discord's age verification backlash in UK linked to Peter Thiel-backed company Persona
content: Discord's new age verification plans, requiring government IDs in some cases, sparked backlash due to privacy concerns and a recent data breach. The company attempted to reassure users with AI-driven video selfies, but questions persist about biometric data and third-party vendor involvement, particularly with Peter Thiel-backed Persona.

title: IBM’s rout, 'ghost' GDP: Why AI doom loop may be just a 'scary bedtime story'
content: Markets were rattled after a report projected a 2028 worldwide intelligence crisis, claiming AI would decimate professional roles and spark economic freefall, leading to a steep drop in IBM’s share price. Yet many specialists dispute this doomsday timeline, arguing that AI’s impact will unfold more gradually, with outcomes depending significantly on how policymakers manage labor, regulation, and innovation.

title: 'I am not supportive of that': Gukesh slams Kramnik over cheating claims
content: World champion D Gukesh criticised Vladimir Kramnik’s cheating allegations, saying cheating has been made a bigger issue than it is. While firmly against unethical play, Gukesh said he does not support Kramnik’s approach and called for harmony in chess. The 19-year-old spoke ahead of the Prague International Chess Festival, where he hopes to regain form.

title: 'We're 2002': Nitish Kumar's big slip as he loses cool on oppn in assembly - watch
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar lost his composure in the assembly amidst opposition protests alleging rule by "guns and bullets." He mistakenly stated the NDA's strength as "two thousand and two" instead of 202. The protest began over a police baton charge on village chowkidars demanding higher stipends.

title: Iran ups the ante: Tehran finalising deal to buy Chinese anti-ship cruise missiles
content: Iran is reportedly close to finalizing a deal with China for advanced CM-302 supersonic anti-ship missiles, a move that could significantly bolster its naval defense capabilities. The potential transfer comes amid heightened US naval presence and escalating tensions in the region, potentially complicating American efforts to curb Iran's military programs.

title: IBM stock’s worst single-day drop in 25 yrs over Anthropic tool
content: IBM shares plummeted after AI startup Anthropic announced its tool can automate COBOL modernization, threatening IBM's core mainframe business. This AI advancement could compress years-long, costly migration projects into months, impacting recurring revenue from hardware, software, and services. The market reacted swiftly, signaling a potential shift in the legacy IT services landscape.

title: Toilet trouble: US troops feel the 'pressure' as Trump vows to flush out Khamenei regime
content: America's most advanced aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R Ford, is grappling with persistent sewage system failures during its extended deployment near the Middle East. Despite the Navy's assurances of operational readiness, the $13 billion vessel's next-generation plumbing struggles with waste from its 4,600-strong crew, leading to frequent clogs and demanding 19-hour shifts for engineers.

title: Mayank Pawar's Death: Splitsvilla 7 star dies at 37 in Mumbai; prayer meet on Feb 25
content: Splitsvilla 7 fame Mayank Pawar has passed away in Mumbai at the age of 37. The reality star and bodybuilding champion's sudden death has deeply shocked fans and the fitness industry. The exact cause of his passing remains unconfirmed, with a prayer meeting scheduled for February 25, 2026.

title: 'Should play Kohli's role': India batter asked to 'become a chase master'
content: Mohammed Kaif advised Tilak Varma to ignore criticism and stick to his natural anchor role in the T20 World Cup 2026. Tilak struggled with form and failed when he tried to play aggressively against South Africa. Kaif said Tilak should play like Virat Kohli and focus on batting deep, since India already has many attacking players. Tilak is expected to play in India’s key match against Zimbabwe.

title: 'Scrap US trade deal': Rahul dares PM Modi; repeats 'sold India' claim
content: Rahul Gandhi claimed Union minister Hardeep Puri's name in the infamous Epstein files was released to "threaten" the PM, and that there are "videos and messages which have not been released from the millions of Epstein files" held up in the US. In another allegation, Rahul claimed that the case against Adani in the United States is not against the industrialist but against PM Modi.​​

title: Major blow for India! Captain skips fielding after injury, doubt over next match
content: India suffered a setback in the first ODI against Australia as captain Harmanpreet Kaur injured her knee while batting and did not field, with Smriti Mandhana leading instead. Harmanpreet scored 53, while Mandhana made 58, but India were restricted to 214. Australia chased it easily, winning by six wickets to lead 1-0. Beth Mooney starred with 76 as India now await Harmanpreet’s fitness update.

title: Kerala now Keralam: Centre gives nod for name change; Tharoor quips, ‘Keralamite, Keralamian’?
content: The Union Cabinet has approved renaming Kerala to 'Keralam', following a state assembly resolution. This move, aimed at reflecting the name in Malayalam, has sparked a linguistic debate. Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor humorously questioned the new terms for residents, asking how people from the state now would be referred to, and what happens to terms like “Keralite and Keralan”.

title: Watch: Zelenskyy reveals his 'base' in Kyiv; taunts Putin - watch
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy revealed the Kyiv bunker where he directed the nation's initial war response, recalling US President Biden's offer to evacuate him. He famously replied, 'I need ammunition, not a ride.

title: 'Good news will come': Sasikala hints at new political party ahead of Tamil Nadu polls
content: Former AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has hinted at launching a new political party, making the announcement during an event commemorating former chief minister Jayalalithaa's birth anniversary. She said, "Good news will come". This potential move could introduce a three-way contest in the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, alongside the existing DMK and BJP-AIADMK alliances.

title: PM Modi meets Manipur CM, his two deputies in New Delhi
content: BJP's Yumnam Khemchand Singh was sworn in as CM of Manipur on February 4, reinstating the NDA government along with Kuki legislator Nemcha Kipgen and Naga MLA Losii Dikho as his deputies, marking a fresh spin on shared governance in a multi-ethnic state riven by the Meitei-Kuki conflict. Governor AK Bhalla also administered the oath of office to BJP's Konthoujam Govindas and Khuraijam Loken Singh of NPP as cabinet ministers at the Lok Bhavan ceremony.

title: UPSC extends CSE 2026 deadline after portal issues — check application dates & details
content: The Union Public Service Commission has extended the application deadline for Civil Services Examination 2026 and Indian Forest Service Examination 2026 until February 27, 2026, 6 pm, after technical issues affected the online portal due to heavy traffic. The recruitment will fill 933 vacancies through Preliminary, Main and interview stages. Eligibility requires a bachelor’s degree and age between 21 and 32 years. Serving IAS, IPS and IFS officers cannot reapply unless they resign.

title: 5 Pakistani cops killed in coordinated militant attack in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
content: No group immediately claimed responsibility for the assault, which appeared to be carefully timed to target responding officers. The violence came just a day after another deadly episode in nearby Karak. On Monday, attackers used an explosives-laden drone to hit a paramilitary post, injuring several personnel. As the wounded were being transported for treatment, the assailants ambushed two ambulances.

title: Saudi Arabia opens domestic Hajj 2026 registration: Eligibility, dates & steps you need to know
content: Saudi Arabia has opened Hajj 1447 AH (2026) registration for citizens and residents inside the Kingdom via the Nusuk platform. Priority is given to first-time pilgrims, with package bookings commencing soon. Applicants must meet age and health requirements, with residents needing a valid permit of over one year.

title: Iran's war calculus: Why Khamenei is betting on Trump for his regime's survival
content: The United States has built up one of its largest Middle East deployments in years, with two aircraft carriers moving into position and additional warships and aircraft arriving in the region. The State Department has also begun thinning out exposed outposts. Meanwhile, Iran is preparing itself for a protracted war with US. It is dispersing authority, hardening infrastructure, rehearsing retaliation, tightening internal security, and signaling that it can raise global costs through Hormuz and regional targeting.

title: NRR drama peaks: How Team India can still reach T20 World Cup semis
content: India's T20 World Cup 2026 semifinal path is challenging. A significant loss to South Africa has impacted their net run rate. India must win their upcoming matches convincingly. Dominant victories are crucial to improve their net run rate and secure a spot in the semifinals. The team faces Zimbabwe and West Indies next.

title: Stock market crash: Sensex plunges 1,000 points - top reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex tanked in trade on Tuesday on weak global cues and IT stocks rout along with fresh tariff threats from US President Donald Trump. While Nifty50 dropped over 300 points, BSE Sensex went below the 82,000 intraday.

title: J'khand plane crash: Family took loan to book aircraft; to save 1, 7 died in tragedy
content: An air ambulance carrying a burn victim, his wife, and nephew crashed in Chatra, killing all seven on board. The family had taken a loan and used savings for the costly evacuation to Delhi for advanced treatment after a hotel fire.

title: ‘In touch with Hafiz Saeed’: How LeT's Shabir Ahmed is linked to 8 held for plotting terror attack
content: Delhi Police has busted a Bangladesh terror module run by Shabir Ahmed Lone, who was in direct contact with LeT commander Hafeez Saeed. Lone, a Kashmiri resident, was released on bail in 2019 and fled to Bangladesh. He was tasked with recruiting and radicalizing illegal Bangladeshi migrants in India, arranging fake IDs and weapons for potential attacks.

title: Want to meet Punch? The viral baby monkey with plushie from Japan has finally found friends
content: A seven-month-old Japanese macaque, Punch, rejected by his mother and bullied by peers, found solace in a plush toy named 'Ora-mama'. This heartwarming story of resilience and connection went viral globally, drawing immense sympathy and support. Recent updates reveal Punch has now made new friends at the zoo, signifying his growing acceptance within his social group.

title: 'Dear Mumma..I am sorry....they killed me': Four years after her son's death, mother awaits justice
content: Arti Malhotra's son Arvey died by suicide On February 24, 2022 after enduring severe school bullying.  Four years later, Arti continues her fight for justice. She advocates for anti-bullying laws and accountability from the school.  Despite ongoing efforts, the legal process faces delays.  Arti's activism highlights the immense pain of a mother seeking closure and justice for her child.

title: 'Rioting charges added to FIR': Delhi Police on Youth Congress 'shirtless' protest
content: Delhi Police has added rioting charges to the FIR against Indian Youth Congress members. The group staged a shirtless protest at the AI Impact Summit last week. Police stated the protesters attempted to breach security and injured personnel. Eight individuals, including IYC chief Uday Bhanu Chib, have been arrested.

title: 'Wounded yet in high spirits': Army shares update on dog Tyson who 'took the first bullet'
content: Army dog Tyson, a German Shepherd, bravely took a bullet to the leg while leading troops into a terrorist hideout during Operation Trashi-I in Kishtwar. His courageous actions helped neutralize three Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists. Wounded but spirited, Tyson is recovering well, embodying unwavering devotion to duty and serving as a true warrior.

title: Iran: Military chopper crashes into market; 4 dead
content: A military helicopter crashed into a bustling market in central Iran, claiming at least four lives, including the pilot and co-pilot. The aircraft was reportedly on a training mission when it fell in Dorcheh, Isfahan province. This incident follows another recent aviation fatality, highlighting Iran's ongoing challenges with its aging air fleet.

title: Ranveer–Farhan ‘Don 3’ clash deepens amid Rs 40 cr dispute, Producers Guild advises legal route
content: A major fallout between Ranveer Singh and Excel Entertainment over 'Don 3' has reached a deadlock. Mediation efforts have failed, with the Producers Guild advising legal recourse. Ranveer refutes claims of backing out without notice, citing prolonged delays. Both parties remain firm on their demands, preventing any compromise.

title: Can India accept an electric sports car? Decoding MG Cyberster sales
content: India's EV market is expanding beyond practical cars, with the MG Cyberster electric sports car exceeding expectations. Despite its premium price and niche appeal, over 580 units were sold in its first six months. This indicates a growing segment of Indian buyers seeking performance and excitement in electric vehicles, proving that electric sports cars are no longer an unrealistic dream.

title: Chilling murder caught on cam: Noida youth ambushed, shot dead at doorstep in broad daylight
content: A man named Nitin was shot dead in Greater Noida due to an old rivalry. CCTV footage shows multiple assailants attacking and shooting the victim. Police have launched an investigation to apprehend all those involved in the killing.

title: Israel has Biblical right over Middle East? Furore over Trump ally’s remark
content: A podcast remark about biblical borders triggers diplomatic backlash, exposing fault lines in Trump’s Middle East strategy and within MAGA itself.

title: Trump's new global tariff aims to balance payments, but is it even needed?
content: New 10% US import duties took effect Tuesday, following the Supreme Court's rejection of President Trump's previous tariff framework. While the administration cites a balance of payments deficit, economists largely disagree, pointing to factors like increased foreign investment. Legal challenges are anticipated due to the statute's questionable application.

title: 'Accused On The Run, Will Be Arrested': Arunachal Chief Minister On Racist Attack On 3 Women In Delhi
content: A man and a woman who hurled racist abuse on three women from Arunachal Pradesh on camera are allegedly on the run, according to the chief minister of the border state in the northeast region.

title: Australian PM Anthony Albanese Evacuated From Residence After Bomb Threat
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was evacuated from his official residence over a bomb threat on Tuesday. He was taken to a separate location for several hours.

title: Iran Faces US Wrath, But 5,000 Sailors On USS Ford Face 650 Failing Toilets
content: The USS Gerald R. Ford has been at sea since June last year. The Republican leader's decision to extend its deployment for a second time has snowballed into a growing list of problems, such as blocked toilets and sewage troubles.

title: Opinion: Opinion | West Bengal Polls: Why Both Trinamool And BJP Want To Woo The Rajbanshis
content: The BJP's march in Bengal has been primarily powered by the Rajbanshi and Matua communities, spread across the northern and eastern border regions, respectively.

title: Class 10 Student Killed In Karnataka Assault, 2 Minors Detained
content: A Class 10 student was killed after being assaulted in Uragadur on the outskirts of Shivamogga city in Karnataka, leading to tension in the area.

title: Lover's Blackmail, Daughter's Wedding: The Case Of Surat Builder's Suicide
content: The death of Tushar Ghelani, a prominent builder in Surat, has sent shockwaves through the city. In a breakthrough, the Umra police have arrested his partner, Poonam Bhadoria, on charges of abetting his suicide.

title: Will AI Replace Software Engineers? What Anthropic CEO Said
content: As the world comes to grips with the gargantuan growth of artificial intelligence and the threat it poses to the job market, Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has some career advice for young professionals.

title: Zelensky Reveals The Bunker From Where He Led Response To Russian Invasion
content: Walking through a warren of tunnels under central Kyiv, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said it was from this secure compound that he started marshalling Ukraine's response to Russia's invasion on February 24, 2022.

title: Anthropic Co-Founder Dario Amodei Explains Why He Left Sam Altman's OpenAI
content: Differences over the vision and approach to artificial intelligence: those were the primary reasons Dario Amodei, co-founder of AI firm Anthropic, left OpenAI.

title: Markets Crash 1,000 Points Amid Rising US-Iran Tensions, Trade Uncertainties
content: The Indian stock markets saw a massive crash today amid rising geopolitical tensions between the US and Iran, concerns over artificial intelligence-led disruption, and trade-related uncertainties.

title: "Was Starting To Despair": Why Anthropic CEO Shifted From Biology To AI
content: Trained as a physicist and biophysicist, Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei once set his sights on curing disease.

title: Opinion: Opinion | If You Don't Care About Taj Mahal's Architect, Why Cry Over Lutyens?
content: The parallel, if one has to be drawn, is not with Shah Jahan and the Taj. It is with the architect of the Taj, and most of us don't know his name either. Why, then, should we bother too much with a British architect?

title: Punjab's Rs 40-Crore Border Plan After Targeted Cop Killings
content: Two Punjab police personnel were found shot dead at a checkpost in Gurdaspur near the Indo-Pak border on Sunday, raising serious concerns about the security situation in the state.

title: What Lack Of A Leader Of Opposition Means For Maharashtra's Democracy
content: In a development unprecedented in the political history of the state, the Maharashtra Budget Session 2026 commenced on February 23 without a recognised Leader of Opposition in either the Legislative Assembly or the Legislative Council.

title: What's Anthropic's Plan In India? CEO Dario Amodei Shows A Preview
content: Anthropic wants to embed itself inside India's powerful IT and consulting ecosystem, CEO Dario Amodei has said.

title: Jewel Thief, Ravan Fan: Lucknow Man Who Chopped Father Had Disturbing Past
content: Days after the chopped body of a 50-year-old businessman was recovered from a blue drum in Lucknow, chilling details have emerged about the killer, who happens to be the man's 21-year-old son.

title: 'Protest Not Anarchy Licence': Ex Judges Slam Shirtless Protest At AI Event
content: More than 270 former judges and retired officials, including top cops, have slammed the Indian Youth Congress's shirtless protest at Bharat Mandapam during the AI Impact Summit

title: Need For Sovereign AI Sparks Swadeshi Data Centre Surge In India
content: India's data centre industry is on the cusp of exponential expansion as the country embraces artificial intelligence at population scale.

title: "Attacks By Pakistanis": Owner After Shutting Down Indian Eatery In London
content: An Indian-origin restaurant owner in London has claimed that he has to shut down his eatery after a 16-year run due to a combination of factors, including repeated "disturbances and attacks by Pakistanis."

content: the 2030 Olympics will be spread across the country on sunday . the ice seemed tilted very much in the american's favor for the first time . it's clear Team USA is building a potential dynasty . if you paid attention in the lead-up and during the Games, it is clear team USA could have some growing pain .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions

title: 🎖️ Shots of gold: Winter Olympics, in pictures
content: the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics have come to a close, bringing thrilling action and memorable moments in spades . we compiled collages that take a look at the story of each of the Games' days overall, as well as one specific snapshot of particular significance .
